narrative.narrative: Republic Airlines was formed in 1979 after the merger of North Central Airlines and Southern Airways, the first one after the airline industry deregulation. Their headquarters were in Minneapolis but their largest hub was Detroit. In 1980 they bought Hughes Airwest and became the largest U.S airline by number of airports served, and were the sixth largest in the U.S. They had the worlds largest fleet of DC-9s at 133 total of many variations, and 22 727's of many variations, 8 MD-82s, 6 757's and 2 Convair CV-580's. A total of 171 planes. They suffered debt in the early 80's after spending on aquisitions and new planes and had to cut back routes, including reduced service in Phoenix. They served many cities in the U.S, all regions of it, and at least one city in Mexico, and a few in the Caribbean and Toronto and Monteal in Canada.. In 1986 Northwest Orient bought them for $884 million, after the merger Northwest dropped Orient from their name. The aqusition formed a backbone for Northwest's domestic network getting hubs at Minneapolis,Memphis and Detroit. Northwest would merge with Delta in 2008 and lose the Northwest name.
